intro: Galium cajamarcense, commonly known as the Peruvian bedstraw, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of tiny white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium cajamarcense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
